com.github.dylon.liblevenshtein.levenshtein

Class AbstractPositionTransitionFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dylon.liblevenshtein.levenshtein.AbstractPositionTransitionFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPositionTransitionFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MergeAndSplitPositionTransitionFunction, StandardPositionTransitionFunction, TranspositionPositionTransitionFunction

    public abstract class AbstractPositionTransitionFunction
extends Object
implements IPositionTransitionFunction
    Implements common logic shared among the position-transition functions, which for their specific algorithm take one of the positions in a state and a few parameters, and return all posible positions leading from that one, under the constraints of the given paramters and the Levenshtein algorithm.
    Since:
    2.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • indexOf

        protected int indexOf(boolean[] characteristicVector,
                      int k,
                      int i)
        Returns the first index of the characteristic vector between indices, i and k, that is true. This corresponds to the first index of the relevant subword whose element is the character of interest.
        Parameters:
        characteristicVector - Contains relevant subwords, which are booleans denoting whether the index at their locations correspond to the character being sought.
        k - Last index of characteristicVector to examine for the first index of the relevant subword whose element is the character of interest.
        i - First index of characteristicVector to examine for the first index of the relevant subword whose element is the character of interest.
        Returns:
        If a character match exists in the relevant subword, the first index of the relevant subword whose element is it. Otherwise, -1 is returned if no match exists (in the relevant subword). Note that characteristicVector may have more elements than are examined.
